messages.message:
Would appreciate some advice on where to store some information:

A couple of people have had the suggestion to make it so you can "pin" repos. I'm trying to figure out where to store the information about whether a user has a repo pinned. I was thinking in should be part of the `RepoStakeholder` model as something like `has_pinned`, but I'm not sure if it fits the concept of a "stakeholder" since you already have to be a stakeholder to have a repo pinned. Was also considering storing a list of repo ids on the UserProfile but that seems like it could get messy. Am I going in the right direction or does anyone have a better suggestion of where it should be?

This is the right direction. @Heymian has been the Keeper of the Schema in the past so putting heads together with her is a good idea.

For some additional background, one conversation we tend to have whenever this sort of new information comes up is whether we can find some way to put settings on disk and out of the database. (The former of which is east to change, the latter harder)
I’m not sure if there is a clear “disk versus db” answer but it might be worth at least considering. I believe @Anant and @Jesika Haria were the last two to evaluate this potential route
